name: blastocoel
content:
Add to word list
Add to word list
the empty space inside a blastula (= the early stage of development of an animal, consisting of a layer of cells around a hollow space), formed when an egg divides into smaller cells: Under low calcium conditions, large proteins can enter the blastocoel of living embryos. All embryos that had formed a blastocoel cavity were evaluated. Related word
blastula
More examplesFewer examplesThese cells can be microinjected into the blastocoel.This cavity is not a blastocoel; it is a product of morphogenetic cell movements, not of cleavage.The movement of ions such as chloride and bicarbonate contributes to blastocoel formation.
